intro: Conyza bilbaoana, commonly known as Bilbao's conyza, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza bilbaoana is often found in open habitats, contributing to the unique flora of the Canary Islands.
